title: How to make a PDF file using C++ - Quora

response.answer_text: I’d consider using some pre-existing tools and libraries. It can be done by scratch, of course, but you can use C# with the Kdan PDF SDK library to easily create PDF documents. I’m from the Kdan team, and I want to share some features of the PDF SDK, because I think they would be useful to anyone who needs to create PDF features using C. The SDK is based off of over 10 years of experience with PDF Reader, Kdan’s award-winning PDF solution used by over 50 million people. It includes cross-platform support for iOS, Android and Windows, and many features of the PDF Reader. A robust viewer system that can render large documents, text selection and annotation, and even legally enforceable signatures by DottedSign, built in. One of the most economical SDKs to use today, Kdan’s PDF SDK comes with a free trial and code snippets so you can get started right away with your first apps. Download now and see what you can create.

You have some choices here: Google “C++ PDF Library” and sort through all the libraries people have written for C++; Not all might support all the features you might want.Or, you’ll do it the lazy way I do it (At least for me it’s the lazy way :-) ): Install GhostScript, then prepare a PostScript file for your document and let GhostScript do the hard work of creating a PDF-file for you. All you need to learn this way is PostScript and how to call other programs. If you don’t already know PostScript, you are probably better off with 1).
